Package ohos.vibrator.agent

Class VibratorAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.vibrator.agent.VibratorAgent

  • public class VibratorAgent
extends Object
    Manages vibrators on hardware devices.

    This class allows you to query a vibrator based on its ID, check whether the vibrator supports a specific vibration effect, enable the vibrator to vibrate with a certain effect, and disable the vibrator.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    VibrationPattern
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Sensors#MISC_DEVICE

    • Method Detail

      • getVibratorIdList

        public List<Integer> getVibratorIdList​()
        Obtains the IDs of all vibrators on the device.

        This method can be used when you want to query the IDs of all vibrators on the device.

        Returns:
        Returns the IDs of all vibrators on the device.
        Since:
        1

      • isSupport

        public boolean isSupport​(int vibratorId)
        Checks whether a specified vibrator exists on the hardware device.

        This method can be used when you do not know whether a vibrator exists on the device.

        Parameters:
        vibratorId - Indicates the ID of the vibrator. You can use the getVibratorIdList() method to obtain the vibrator ID list.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the vibrator exists; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • isEffectSupport

        public boolean isEffectSupport​(int vibratorId,
                               String effectId)
        Checks whether a specified vibrator supports a preset vibration effect.

        Call this method to check whether the vibrator supports a specific vibration effect before enabling it to vibrate with this effect.

        Parameters:
        vibratorId - Indicates the ID of the vibrator. You can use the getVibratorIdList() method to obtain the vibrator ID list.
        effectId - Indicates the preset vibration effect, which is described in VibrationPattern.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the vibrator supports the specified vibration effect; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • startOnce

        public boolean startOnce​(int vibratorId,
                         int duration)
        Controls a specified vibrator to perform a one-shot vibration at a given duration.

        Your application needs to request the ohos.permission.VIBRATE permission to call this method.

        Parameters:
        vibratorId - Indicates the ID of the vibrator. You can use the getVibratorIdList() method to obtain the vibrator ID list.
        duration - Indicates the duration that the one-shot vibration lasts, in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the vibrator vibrates as expected; returns false otherwise, for example, the given duration for the one-shot vibration is invalid.
        Since:
        4

      • startOnce

        public boolean startOnce​(int vibratorId,
                         String effectId)
        Controls a specified vibrator to perform a one-shot vibration with a preset vibration effect.

        Your application needs to request the ohos.permission.VIBRATE permission to call this method.

        Parameters:
        vibratorId - Indicates the ID of the vibrator. You can use the getVibratorIdList() method to obtain the vibrator ID list.
        effectId - Indicates the preset vibration effect, which is described in VibrationPattern.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the vibrator vibrates as expected; returns false otherwise, for example, the preset vibration effect is not supported.
        Since:
        4

      • start

        public boolean start​(int vibratorId,
                     VibrationPattern vibrationEffect)
        Controls a specified vibrator to vibrate with a custom effect.

        You can customize a vibration effect in VibrationPattern. Your application needs to request the ohos.permission.VIBRATE permission to call this method.

        Parameters:
        vibratorId - Indicates the ID of the vibrator. You can use the getVibratorIdList() method to obtain the vibrator ID list.
        vibrationEffect - Indicates a custom vibration effect. You can customize the effect of a one-shot vibration using the VibrationPattern.createSingle(int, int) method, and customize the effect of a periodic vibration using the VibrationPattern.createPeriod(int[], int) or VibrationPattern.createPeriod(int[], int[], int) method.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the vibrator vibrates as expected; returns false otherwise, for example, the custom vibration effect is not supported.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        VibrationPattern

      • startOnce

        public boolean startOnce​(int duration)
        Controls this vibrator to perform a one-shot vibration at a given duration.

        Your application needs to request the ohos.permission.VIBRATE permission to call this method.

        Parameters:
        duration - Indicates the duration that the one-shot vibration lasts, in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the vibrator vibrates as expected; returns false otherwise, for example, the given duration for the one-shot vibration is invalid.
        Since:
        4

      • startOnce

        public boolean startOnce​(String effectId)
        Controls this vibrator to perform a one-shot vibration with a preset vibration effect.

        Your application needs to request the ohos.permission.VIBRATE permission to call this method.

        Parameters:
        effectId - Indicates the preset vibration effect, which is described in VibrationPattern.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the vibrator vibrates as expected; returns false otherwise, for example, the preset vibration effect is not supported.
        Since:
        4

      • start

        public boolean start​(String effectId,
                     boolean isLooping)
        Controls this vibrator to perform a periodic vibration with a preset vibration effect.
        Parameters:
        effectId - Indicates the preset vibration effect, which is described in VibrationPattern.
        isLooping - Specifies whether to start a periodic vibration. The value true means to start a periodic vibration, and false means the opposite.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the vibrator vibrates as expected; returns false otherwise, for example, the preset vibration effect does not support periodic vibration.
        Since:
        5

      • start

        public boolean start​(VibrationPattern vibrationEffect)
        Controls this vibrator to vibrate with a custom vibration effect.

        You can customize a vibration effect in VibrationPattern. Your application needs to request the ohos.permission.VIBRATE permission to call this method.

        Parameters:
        vibrationEffect - Indicates a custom vibration effect. You can customize the effect of a one-shot vibration using the VibrationPattern.createSingle(int, int) method, and customize the effect of a periodic vibration using the VibrationPattern.createPeriod(int[], int) or VibrationPattern.createPeriod(int[], int[], int) method.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the vibrator vibrates as expected; returns false otherwise, for example, the custom vibration effect is not supported.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        VibrationPattern

      • stop

        public boolean stop​(int vibratorId,
                    String stopMode)
        Stops the vibration of a vibrator.

        This method can be used when you no longer need the vibrator to vibrate.

        Parameters:
        vibratorId - Indicates the ID of the vibrator. You can use the getVibratorIdList() method to obtain the vibrator ID list.
        stopMode - Indicates the mode of the vibration to stop. The values can be time, preset, and customized, respectively representing a one-shot vibration effect, a preset vibration effect, and a custom vibration effect.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the vibration is normally stopped; returns false otherwise, for example, the specified stop mode is invalid.
        Since:
        1

      • stop

        public boolean stop​()
        Stops the vibration of this vibrator.

        This method can be used when you no longer need the vibrator to vibrate.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the vibration is normally stopped; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4
